title: Fix date format to DD/MM/YYYY and add Total Orders tab enhancements

requirements.text: Fix date parsing in `frontend/src/utils/excelParser.ts` so that Order Date is always interpreted and stored as DD/MM/YYYY. The parser must not swap day and month (no MM/DD/YYYY treatment). It must correctly handle dates from any year, including 2025 and 2026. Both string-format dates (e.g. '19/02/2026') and Excel serial numbers must resolve to the correct DD/MM/YYYY value. Dates currently showing as 'No date' on the dashboard because of failed parsing (e.g. dates like 13/02/2026, 16/02/2026 shown in the uploaded screenshots) must be displayed correctly after the fix.

quotes: you're updating the data as MM/DD/YYYY but it should only be in standard DD/MM/YYY and it can be any year even 2025 or 2026

acceptanceCriteria: A date string '19/02/2026' in the Excel file is parsed and displayed as '19 Feb 26' (or equivalent DD/MM/YYYY display), not '02/19/2026' or 'No date'.
A date string '17/12/2025' is parsed and displayed correctly as a December 2025 date.
Excel serial number dates are converted correctly without day/month swapping.
No valid DD/MM/YYYY date from any year results in 'No date' after the fix.
All dates in the dashboard order rows display in DD/MM/YYYY (or equivalent readable) format.

requirements.text: In the Total Orders tab (`frontend/src/components/dashboard/TotalOrdersTab.tsx`), add or extend the search bar so that it filters orders by Order Number, Generic Name, and Design Code. The search must be case-insensitive and filter across all design groups simultaneously, showing only matching rows (and their parent design group header if at least one row matches).

quotes: Search bar in total orders tab should be able to search ( Order number, generic name, design code)

acceptanceCriteria: Typing a partial or full Order Number in the search bar filters the displayed rows to only those matching.
Typing a partial or full Generic Name filters rows accordingly.
Typing a partial or full Design Code filters rows accordingly.
Design group headers with no matching rows are hidden when a search term is active.
Clearing the search bar restores all groups and rows.
Search is case-insensitive.

requirements.text: In the Total Orders tab, under every design group, make each order row fully clickable â€” clicking anywhere on the row (not just the checkbox) should toggle the row's selection state. This must work consistently across all design groups rendered in the tab.

quotes: Under every design group, selection of rows can be done by clicking on any part of the row.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking anywhere on a row (outside the checkbox itself) toggles that row's checkbox selection.
Clicking the checkbox directly also still toggles selection.
The row shows a visual selected state (e.g. highlighted background) when selected.
Multiple rows can be selected by clicking on different rows.

requirements.text: In the Total Orders tab, add a 'Mark Ready' button inside each design group header/footer. Clicking it marks all currently selected rows within that design group as Ready. Additionally, when the top-level 'Select All' checkbox is checked, a bulk 'Mark Ready' button must appear at the top of the tab to mark all selected orders (across all design groups) as Ready at once.

quotes: Give the *Mark Ready* button in each design group so that it could be marked from there itself and On the top when *select all* is checked then *mark ready* on top shows to do it in bulk for all design codes

acceptanceCriteria: Each design group displays a 'Mark Ready' button within the group.
Clicking a group's 'Mark Ready' button marks only the selected rows within that group as Ready.
If no rows are selected in a group, the group-level 'Mark Ready' button is disabled or shows an appropriate state.
When the top-level 'Select All' checkbox is checked, a 'Mark Ready' button appears at the top of the Total Orders tab.
Clicking the top-level 'Mark Ready' button marks all selected orders across all design groups as Ready.
After marking as ready, the affected rows are removed from the Pending list and appear in the Ready tab.

constraints: Do not change the overall dashboard layout or any other tab's behaviour.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend data model and API must not change.
nonGoals: Changing the design or layout of any tab other than Total Orders.
Adding search functionality to tabs other than Total Orders.
Modifying the Ready, Hallmark, Customer Orders, Karigars, or Unmapped tabs.
Adding new backend endpoints or modifying the Motoko actor.
